page.title: 06NEW HOUSING IN STEWARTON
page.content: Four new developments of private housing estates are on the outskirts of the town.Rush and Tompkins have built and are still building villas and bungalows in the Ravenscraig area.These sell as they are completed.Green Park Homes have built bungalows in the Kirkford area where the old established mill of Thomas Mackie's was knocked down early in the year.Private sites are being developed with a variety of houses at the top of Bowes Rigg.In St Columba's Church Glebe there is a small estate of bungalows.In the centre of the town a factory has been converted into Springwell Flats.These new developments and the practice of council tenants buying their homes means that 80% of the houses in the town are owner occupied.
